Thoughts on Creation.

Home Work About

Humanity was willed in being by a divine being, or created by a unconscious evolutionary process, so one of life’s meanings, life’s purposes, is to emulate our creation by being creative.

  • Love of beauty is taste. The creation of beauty is art. Ralph Waldo Emerson
  • The opposite of war is not peace, it’s creation. Jonathan Larson
  • There is no greater joy than that of feeling oneself a creator. The triumph of life is expressed by creation. Stephen Fry
  • The art of creation is older than the art of killing. Ed Koch
  • As we are created, so may we create. Rev. Elizabeth Mount
Photography

My interest in photography goes back to early childhood when I used my father’s camera to take pictures of war game play at school in the second grade. Since then it has been off and on, more off than on. I’ve shot film, developed my own black & white film, learned monochrome printing, and eventually through the Smithsonian Resident Associates studio arts class, learned to print color.

After a hiatus of a few years I switched to exclusively digital photography in 2012. Film photography could be fun but it was a laborious process compared to digital photography, not to mention being more expensive.

With retirement photography will serve as a challenge, a discipline, and a spiritual practice to celebrate life. In 2021 I took a class called “A Year of Creative Photography” which has pushed me along the path I am seeking.
